Yes, the limitations in VR headset compatibility with Mac computers may be worth it for the unique experience of VR, depending on your personal preferences and interests. If you are mainly interested in VR gaming, you may find that the selection of games available for Macs is limited compared to Windows-based PCs, so it may be a consideration when choosing a VR headset.

That being said, there are still plenty of VR applications, simulations and experiences that are compatible with Mac computers, and some VR headsets, such as the HTC Vive and Valve Index, do have limited compatibility with Mac computers. So, if you have your heart set on VR and are a Mac user, it may still be possible to get a VR headset that works with your computer.

Ultimately, it depends on your personal preferences and what you want to get out of the VR experience. If you are looking for a unique and immersive experience that goes beyond traditional 2D screens, VR may be worth exploring, even with the limitations of Mac compatibility.
